videos.title: Episode 101: Ozark Gravel Doom with Ed Rogers
videos.channel: Dirty Chain Podcast Michigan Midpack Media
videos.description: Ozark Gravel Doom - the 400 mile bikepacking race out of Arkansas' Ozark National Forest. Ed Rogers joins the podcast to talk about his Doom experience in both 2023 and 2024 where he placed an impressive 2nd and 4th place respectively.

videos.title: Impossible Route  OZARKS  ☠️🔥
videos.description:
In May 2025, former pros Jeremiah Bishop and Alex Howes team up with rookie rider Malaki Caldwell to take on the Ozarks Mega Loop—a rugged new 300-mile bikepacking route that anchors the Fayetteville Bikepacking Routes Network.
But this isn’t just a ride.
The creator of Ozark Doom, the region’s hardest race—Dr. Doom himself—issues a brutal challenge: hit five secret checkpoints within a 40-hour cutoff.
Is it possible?
On paper, the Mega Loop is mostly dirt roads… but in reality?
Let’s just say it was way tougher than it sounded.☠️🔥        

MORE ----   http://www.theimpossibleroute.com ☠️ 


#ImpossibleRoute
#GravelCycling
#Ozarks 
#AdventureDocumentary

.................................................
Editor: Olivia Graziano

Producers: Olivia Graziano, Benjamin Saheb

Executive Producers: Jeremiah Bishop 

Cinematography: Ben Saheb, Olivia Graziano

Editor: Olivia Graziano
 


Music   Licensed By Music Bed and Gar hole Records.

Sound Design: Olivia Graziano - Jeremiah Bishop  

“Dog Wood Variations” By Austin Cash 

"A Manly Man" by Bytheway-May
 
"Geographia (Night Cycles Version)" by Blake Ewing 

"Ghosts - Campfire Version - Instrumental" by The National Parks 

"Vaquero" by Lane King

"Let’s Go, Go, Go" by Bridger 

"Kleos" by Charlie Ryan 

"Regain, Once Lost" by A. Taylor 

"Nebraska Gloom" by Jo Blankenburg 

"Rocking Chair" by Jo Blankenburg 

"Dirt" by Jo Blankenburg

Route 

 Bike Packing Roots  

Enhancements: Dr Doom Andrew Onermaa 

Crew: 

Production logistics Ryan West

Production Assistance; Victoria Dubois and Corey Dubois

Graphic Design: Chris Lankford 

Logistics Coordinator: Ryan West

Photography: Olivia Graziano
 
Riders: 

Jeremiah Bishop

Alex Howes

Malaki Caldwell

Guests 

Sarah King 

Cadwell Family

Ryan West 

 Kelly Mulhollan

Donna Mulhollan 


Special Thanks:

Experience Fayetteville Sarah King, Jennifer Walker

Emma Reed - Calligrapher

Stonebreaker hotel Staff magic hand  

Ozark Ball Museum and Ozark Instrument Museum 


Doom additional footage
John Mathews and Danny Luksa   
Fatpigeon Media

HorseShoe Canyon Ranch  

And importantly the kind folks of North West Arkansas for their hospitality!

videos.title: Ep. 77: Ozark Gravel Randonneur/ Highlands Gravel Classic; Andrew Onermaa and Brannon Pack
videos.description: Great big gravely things are happening in NW Arkansas and this week we talk with Andrew Onermaa of the Ozark Gravel Cyclists and Director of a new event - the Ozark Randonneur this September. The race is also being hosted by Experience Fayetteville, so we bring on Fayetteville's Director of Cycling Tourism Brannon Pack. Between the two of them there are events and rides available throughout the year in NW Arkansas and we touch on a whole bunch of them, including the Highlands Gravel Classic, the U.S. UCI Gravel World Championship qualifier. Ozark Gravel Cyclists: www.ozarkgravelcyclists.comExperience Fayetteville: https://www.experiencefayetteville.com/gravel-ridingHighlands Gravel Classic: https://www.experiencefayetteville.com/experience/cycling/highlands-gravel-classic.     Another race worth putting on the calendar is the multi-surface Core4 Race in Iowa City, Iowa on August 19, 2023. Get everything you need to know about the 100-, 50-, or 25-mile races which can be done solo or as part of a team at www.core4.bike         Please consider supporting Bike Talk with Dave by rating, reviewing and sharing on your favorite podcast platform. We'd invite you to support the show financially at www.buymeacoffee.com or on Venmo @David-Mable. You'll receive a Bike Talk with Dave sticker!          Bike Talk with Dave is supported by Chain and Spoke Coffee. Order your favorite flavor at www.chainandspoke.com. The Chain and Spoke retail location is open now in Des Moines, Iowa featuring great coffee, bikes and the new Bike Talk with Dave Studio!         Bikeiowa.com is the online host of Bike Talk with Dave. Get your event listed on the extensive ride and race calendar for free! Create an account and add and edit your event to reach thousands of cyclists.       Follow Bike Talk with Dave on Instagram and Facebook so you don't miss any of the fun, and you can now find every episode on your computer at www.biketalk.bike.       Tune in next week for a conversation with Gravel Hall of Famer and founder of the Garmin Gravel Worlds: Cory Godfrey! https://www.gravel-worlds.com/race-day

videos.title: An EPIC Gravel Adventure Ride in the Ozarks | THE RAPHA PRESTIGE OZARKS STORY
videos.description:
Rapha puts on these special events called Prestige rides. There once a year and located in some of the craziest places on earth. This once was in the Arkansa Ozarks and OH MY IT WAS AMAZING! 

Endless gravel roads made for this cycling adventure to be the best bike trip I have ever taken. Riding gravel bikes on gravel roads with gravel people and gravel gravel gravel, is that good youtube? Will you recommend my gravel ride video to people who like Rapha clothing and gravel bikes and thin mustaches and flavored soda water that tastes like nothing? Thanks, that would be sweet.

How it works is you have a 4 man team and there is a staggered start so everyone doesnt start at once. The route is announced the night before and there really isnt any support. So there is some navigation aspects to it as well. 

Allied cycle works got me dialed in on the best gravel bike I have ever ridden. Just for the weekend though, I didnt get to keep it. We rode around the town on Friday and then the big day on Saturday and then a tour of Walmart on Sunday. 

I want to go back so bad, this part of the world was insane! A HUGE thank you ZACHARY PIÑA! This dude made this happen! 

Also, I havent posted a video in a while because I have been hyper focused on work and family. 2019 is gonna be big for cycling and I need to put in the time with the day job and fam to allow for me to accomplish what I want to do in 2019.
